title: Restore persistent full-screen cruise ship hero background on homepage

requirements.summary: Make the homepage Hero use the cruise ship image as the single full-viewport background with a graceful fallback and no post-deploy disappearance.
acceptanceCriteria: On the home page (no share link present), the Hero section renders a cruise ship photo that covers the full viewport (no letterboxing) using a cover-style layout.
The cruise ship image remains visible after a rebuild/redeploy (no regression where it disappears).
If the cruise ship image cannot be loaded, the UI shows a graceful visual fallback (e.g., a solid/gradient background) rather than an empty/blank hero area.

file_operations.description: Refactor Hero background rendering so the cruise ship image is the single, full-viewport (w/h) cover background for the hero area; remove/disable the competing sunset background layer; add a load-check (e.g., preloading via Image or an with onError) to switch to a non-blank gradient/solid fallback when the image fails; keep existing overlays/text readability while ensuring the image is always present on the non-share homepage.

requirements.summary: Ensure the cruise ship hero image exists as a static public asset and is referenced consistently from Hero via the exact required path.
acceptanceCriteria: The file frontend/public/assets/generated/cruise-ship-hero.dim_1600x900.jpg exists in the project and is served by the frontend.
The Hero component uses /assets/generated/cruise-ship-hero.dim_1600x900.jpg as the background source (no broken links / 404s in browser devtools).

file_operations.description: Add/commit the generated static hero image asset at this exact path so it is bundled and served reliably across rebuilds/redeploys.

Update Hero to reference the cruise ship hero asset using the exact required public path /assets/generated/cruise-ship-hero.dim_1600x900.jpg (centralize into a single constant to avoid regressions and inconsistent paths).
